What is the last name of the oldest of the American Founding Fathers?
column5: Benjamin Franklin was, by far the oldest, with Washington and Adams a distant second and third.

column1: What year was Benjamin Franklin born?
column5: Born in 1706, Franklin was 26 years older than Washington and almost 30 years older than Adams.

column1: Which Founding Father is known as the Father of Our Country?
column5: The stoic Washington served as General of the Continental Army without pay, earning him the respect of all Americans.

column1: Which Founding Father is the principal author of the Declaration of Independence?
column5: Jefferson's original version harshly accused King Greorge of bringing slavery to America, but it was deleted from the final version.

column1: Which Founding Father negotiated a peaceful end to the Quasi-War with France in 1800?
column5: Attacks by the French on American ships during the French Revolution was called a Quasi-War. Adams negotiated peace despite widespread calls for war.

column1: Which Founding Father was given a slave, only to free it immediately?
column5: Slavery was obviously inconsistent with the principles of liberty, but no one could see an easy way out.  Samuel Adams wanted no part of it.

column1: Which Founding Father was secretly asked to betray Washington, and revealed the plot to him rather than join it?
column5: Rather than join the Conway Cabal, Patrick Henry informed Washington that Brigadier General Thomas Conway was plotting against him.

column1: Which Founding Father agreed to move the nation's capitol to Washington DC in exchange for support for his economic proposals?
column5: Originally located in New York City, Hamilton agreed to move it south in exchange for support for his plan to pay off debts still owed by the states.

column1: Which Founding Father worked closely with Alexander Hamilton to write the Federalist Papers?
column5: James Madison wrote twenty nine of the eighty five Federalist essays, while John Jay wrote five and Hamilton wrote the other fifty one.

column1: Which Founding Father negotiated a trade agreement with England in 1795 that avoided war but was extremely unpopular with many Americans?
column5: The Jay Treaty resolved lingering issues with England and faced widespread opposition, but was eventually ratified, removing barriers to trade.
